name: Aggro
description: One of the 3 main deck archetypes. An archetype highly dependent on creature combat and aggressive attacks. Aggro decks generally have a low mana curve and try to overwhelm the opponent before they can establish their plan.
quote: I love playing Aggro. I bought the monsters I'm gonna swing with em

name: Allied Colors
description: The five pairings of colors adjacent to each other on the color wheel. The names are derived from their respective Ravnican guilds, those being...
- Azorius: WU
- Dimir: UB
- Rakdos: BR
- Gruul: RG
- Selesnya: GW
These colors are ideologically similar, hence their allied nature.

name: Alpha Strike
description: Attacking with every creature you have in a final attack for lethal damage
quote: Yeah I'm just gonna alpha strike you for lethal.

name: Anthem
description: Any effect which buffs all of a players creatures. Named after Glorious Anthem.
quote: I play Always Watching, it's an anthem giving my nontoken creatures +1/+1

name: Aristocrat
description: A creature with an activated ability involving sacrificing another creature. Also refers to a deck archetype centered around this strategy

name: Abzan
description: The wedge combination of WBG, named after the respective clan of Tarkir

name: Azorious
description: The allied color pair of WU, named after the Ravnican Guild

name: Bant
description: The shard combination of UWG, named after the shard of Alara

name: Basic Land
description: The 6 variants of lands which can tap to produce a color of mana, as well as their snow-covered variants. These types are...
Plains (W)
Island (U)
Swamp (B)
Mountain (R)
Forest (G)
Wastes (C)
Basic lands are one of the few cards which bypass deckbuilding restrictions, such as the 4-of-a-kind rule in 60-card formats, and the singleton rule in Commander

name: Battle
description: A card type introduced in March of the Machine. FIX THIS
quote: This is a quote using the word - Quote Sayer

name: Board Wipe
description: A spell that somehow disposes of all creatures currently in play. Board wipes are typically symmetrical, wiping out the caster's creatures as well, however asymmetrical boardwipes do exist, but are usually much more expensive
quote: Yeah this board looks bad for me, imma just cast a board wipe

name: Bomb
description: A card powerful enough to change the course of the game on its own. Usually used in the context of limited formats, where drafting or opening a bomb greatly improves one's chances.
quote: I got carried so hard by that bomb I drafted last time

name: Boros
description: The enemy color pair of WR, named after the Ravnican Guild

name: Bounce
description: A spell or effect that returns a permanant to its owner's hand
quote: I'll cast Desculpting Blast and bounce your 4/4 flyer

name: BREAD
description: A draft strategy to help prioritize which cards to draft. The term is an acronym for
- Bomb
- Removal
- Evasion
- Aggro
- Dud

The term is prolific, however some consider it outdated as a result of modern set design, as well as the nebulous nature of the evasion, aggro, and dud categories. Nonetheless, it is still a helpful strategy for people starting out with drafting
quote: This is a quote using the word - Quote Sayer

name: Burn
description: A source of direct damage, that being damage dealt outside of combat
quote: I'll use Lightning Bolt to burn you for 3 damage

name: Cantrip
description: A spell or ability with a 'Draw a Card' effect tacked on. A spell with this ability effectively replaces itself in your hand
quote: I can't believe that spell's a cantrip considering how broken it is

name: CEDH
description: Competitive Elder Dragon Highlander. A subset of Commander focused around playing to win as efficiently as possible with the strongest possible decks. Game Changers, infinite combos, land destruction, anything goes as long as it hasn't been banned.
quote: I've been getting into CEDH lately and wow it's crazy just how insane some of these decks are.

name: Chaff
description: Unremarkable cards, unlikely to be included in a constructed deck. Typically common or uncommon cards, but there are exceptions. Very frequently used in the context of 'draft chaff,' cards that are usually considered useless outside of a limited format.
quote: Wow this whole pack is nothing but chaff that's crazy

name: Cheat
description: To play a card with a high mana cost, but actually paying little, if any, of the cost. Commonly achieved with spells and abilities that directly put cards onto the battlefield
quote: IT'S TURN 4 HOW DID YOU CHEAT OUT ETALI THAT QUICK???

name: Chump Block
description: Blocking a high power/toughness creature with a low power/toughness creature, the only goal being to prevent the big creature from damaging you. A chump blocker is any creature used for such a purpose
quote: You're swinging with a 28/28? Ok, I'll just chump block with my human token

name: Clock
description: A threat that will lead to victory over an opponent in a finite number of turns, giving the opponent a time limit in which they must either win or answer the threat
quote: You're at 10 health and can't block my 2/2 flyer. You're on a 5 turn clock.

name: Combat Trick
description: An instant or activated ability that buffs or debuffs a creature, usually played after attacks and blocks have been declared to swing the outcome of the interaction
quote: Hm... I could block her 2/2 with my 3/3, but she might have a combat trick up her sleeve...

name: Combo
description: A combination of multiple cards which produces a beneficial effect, usually greater than the benefits from the separate cards.
Also refers to one of the 3 main deck archetypes, a combo deck uses a combo as its win condition, and is thus designed to set up and protect that combo
Can also be used as a verb when a player initiates the combo, as in to 'combo off'
quote: This guy's combo deck is nuts! Every time he just draws two cards, tutors the rest, and combos off by turn 5!

name: Control
description: One of the 3 main deck archetypes, control decks aim to counter or otherwise negate an opponents threats while steadily gaining advantage. Control decks sacrifice winning the game quickly in exchange for consistently dealing with their opponents' threats.
quote: I can't believe she's a control player. I thought she was cool...

name: Cube
description: A casual format where players create a large pool of cards they then proceed to draft from, in essence creating their very own Magic: The Gathering set.
quote: One of these days I'm gonna make my Sliver cube, just you wait

name: Dead Card
description: A card in hand that is irrelevant or unplayable, either because it cannot be played, or it has become irrelevant.
quote: Really? A mana dork now? What a dead card

name: Decking
description: To run a player's library out of cards, thus causing them to lose the game for being unable to draw cards when required to do so
quote: You know my buddy once accidentally decked himself out last prerelease.

name: Dies to Removal
description: A joking phrase used to ascribe an unrealistic sense of vulnerability to powerful permanents, typically creatures.
quote: I maintain that Nadu shouldn't have been banned. She dies to removal

name: Dimir
description: The allied color pair of UB, named after the Ravnican Guild

name: Dork
description: A creature with unimpressive combat stats. Commonly used to refer to utility creatures which have some other relevant ability.

name: Drain
description: An effect that causes an opponent or creature to take damage or lose life, while the effect's controller gains life.
quote: I've been getting into CEDH lately and wow it's crazy just how insane some of these decks are.

name: Drop
description: A permanent which can be played without major strategic consideration. Usually used in the context of '2-drop', '3-drop' etc., referring to the turn when a permanent can first be played, which is usually equal to its mana value.
quote: It's crucial to my plan that I play my commander as a 3 drop

name: Dud
description: A card generally not worth playing, either because its mana cost is too high for whatever benefit it gives, or because the benefit it gives isn't particularly advantageous
quote: Man I've just been drafting nothing but duds

name: Dual Land
description: Any of the non-basic lands which can produce 2 colors of mana. Especially refers to the original 10 dual lands which featured no restrictions on their use, making them incredibly powerful and rare, especially since all 10 are on the reserved list

Several different kinds of dual lands exist, each with their own advantages and disadvantages. For a comprehensive list of each category of dual lands, check back later. Maybe Duder'll get around to it.
see_also: If you see this, yell at Duder to make the dual lands entries

name: Egg
description: A cheap artifact that can be cracked for a small effect. Derived from the Odyssey 'egg' cycle

name: Enemy Colors
description: The five pairings of colors opposite to each other on the color wheel. The names are derived from their respective Ravnican guilds, those being...
- Orzhov: WB
- Golgari: BG
- Simic: GU
- Izzet: UR
- Boros: RW
These colors are ideologically opposed, hence their enemy nature, however there are still some commonalities between them.

name: Engine
description: A card or combination of cards that produce a powerful (and often repeatable) effect that does not win the game on its own, but is effective in “powering” other strategies.
quote: If you wanna make that deck work you need to make sure to set up your draw engine

name: Esper
description: The shard combination of UWB, named after the shard of Alara

name: ETB
description: Enters the Battlefield. Refers to abilities which trigger when a creature enters the battlefield. Before M10, this was 'comes into play' or CIP, and following Bloomburrow in 2024, this is reduced to 'enters.'

name: Errata
description: An official change to the rules text or type line on cards. Often done to clarify card effects or to preserve the effects of cards as the rules of the game change.

name: Evasion
description: Any ability of a creature that improves its chances of damaging the defending player by limiting what creatures can block it. Examples include Flying, Menace, and Horsemanship, to name a few.
Can arguably apply to other abilities which either make blocking less effective, such as Trample, or unfavorable, such as First Strike
In the context of a draft, applies to any creature featuring some evasion ability

name: Fast Land
description: A dual land that enters the battlefield untapped if the player controls a low number of other lands.

name: Fast Mana
description: Any effect that gives the user two or more extra mana than the mana they untapped with at the beginning of their turn. Examples include the moxen, rituals, and the infamous Black Lotus, to name a few.

name: Fizzle
description: When a spell or ability on the stack fails to resolve and leaves the stack due to its initial targets becoming illegal between it being cast and it resolving.
quote: Well since you blew up my elk, my invigorate will fizzle. Well played

name: Flicker
description: A spell or effect which exiles a permanant then immediately returns it to the battlefield. This allows ETB effects to be reused, be it on the flickered creature or some other creature
quote: I'm gonna flicker my commander so your removal fizzles and I can get another drain off of Blood Artist

name: Floating
description: Mana that a player has acquired but has not spent, caused by a spell or ability producing more mana than the player needed to spend at that time.
quote: I'm gonna tap my Sol Ring and a Mountain, leaving one of the colorless floating, to Abrade your Sol Ring

name: Fog
description: Any effect which prevents combat damage for a turn. Named after Fog.
quote: Whoops forgot that got untapped. Yeah I'm just gonna cast Fog.

name: Glass Cannon
description: A deck with a high potential, but can easily be disrupted. Such decks either win decisively or get utterly demolished.
quote: Man I just can't stop playing glass cannons. I hate getting blown up, but when it works out? Ohhhhh baby.

name: Goldfishing
description: Playing a deck solo against an imaginary opponent who does nothing. Used to test a deck's performance during the deckbuilding process.
quote: I should really goldfish my decks more. They always end up sputtering out in real games.

name: Golgari
description: The enemy color pair of BG, named after the Ravnican Guild

name: Grip
description: A hand of cards. A player with seven cards in hand is said to have a 'full grip'.
quote: I've been getting into CEDH lately and wow it's crazy just how insane some of these decks are.

name: Grixis
description: The shard combination of URB, named after the shard of Alara

name: Group Hug
description: A strategy in multiplayer games centered around benefiting a player's opponents via providing resources to all players, ideally while either benefiting the most from these boons, or punishing those who abuse this generosity.

name: Gruul
description: The allied color pair of RG, named after the Ravnican Guild

name: Kicker
description: An additional cost to a spell that may be paid as it is cast, providing some additional effect. Supposedly one of the two types of keywords in Magic
quote: Kicker {1}{B} - When Heartstabber Mosquito enters the battlefield, if it was kicked, destroy target creature.

name: Tall
description: A creature-based strategy to overwhelm the opponent by attacking with a small number of large creatures. These creatures often outclass or evade the opponent's creatures.
quote: Wow a 48/48? You're going really tall apparently

name: Topdeck
description: To play a card you just drew, especially at exactly the time you need it
quote: Nah don't worry I'll just topdeck some removal

name: Wide
description: A creature-based strategy, often making use of tokens, to overwhelm the opponent by attacking with a huge number of small creatures.
quote: Ok I know you like going wide, but seriously how'd you make 20 guys in 1 turn?
